content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be a differentiable function such that <math alttext="f of 0, equals 5.420" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>5.420</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="f prime of x, equals, the square root of, the sine squared of x, plus x, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>sin</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the value of <math alttext="f of, open parenthesis, 2 pi, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 6.7: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus and Definite Integrals
